availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joshua H. Daniel (Trigg County, Kentucky, miller.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, miller. Kentucky native. Married to Charlotte Alexander Daniel in Trigg County, Kentucky, on February 3, 1847. Miller in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Resident of Trigg County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 313B-314A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 187.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 391A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 44A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film 000321335.
"Joshua H Daniel (1821-1899)," Find A Grave, Memorial 70615763, accessed May 15, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70615763.
